text:
Perhaps the various distributions have simply been fixing it (quietly) in the
hopes that if they fix it quietly it will make their distro look like it
performs better? Nah, no self-respecting geek could live with a way to make
themselves look better. -- There are 10 kinds of people in the world... 
those who understand binary and those who don't. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ -----Original
Message-----
Link: None

metadata.topic: RE: Linux kernel hardcoded to a maximum of 8 cores for the past 15 years and nobody noticed
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: Linux kernel hardcoded to a maximum of 8 cores for the past 15 years and nobody noticed
